overview: From 2025-09-03 to 2025-09-04, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 4 new PRs (4 merged), 1 new issues, and 29 active contributors.

topIssues.title: [Tracker] Proofs: use Drippie to manage hot wallet funds for challenger
topIssues.author: pauldowman
topIssues.body: Funding the challenger would be easier to manage with Drippie. It is not yet being used on mainnet.  This will include monitoring.

topIssues.title: feat(cannon): Support full `mips64r2` ISA
topIssues.author: clabby
topIssues.body:
## Overview

`cannon` does not currently support the full `mips64r2` ISA ([spec](https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/downloads-mips/documents/MIPS_Architecture_MIPS64_InstructionSet_%20AFP_P_MD00087_06.05.pdf)). If we want to be able to support a wider variety of programs running on `cannon`, such as `kona`, we'll need to complete support of the instruction set rather than only using the subset of `r2` instructions that the Go compiler is emitting (MIPS III).

A rough list of instructions that we need to add (which the implementer of this issue should double check) is:

```
SEB Sign-Extend Byte 
SEH Sign-Extend Halftword 
DEXT Doubleword Extract Bit Field 
DEXTM  Doubleword Extract Bit Field Middle 
DEXTU  Doubleword Extract Bit Field Upper 
DINS  Doubleword Insert Bit Field 
DINSM  Doubleword Insert Bit Field Middle 
DINSU  Doubleword Insert Bit Field Upper
DSBH  Doubleword Swap Bytes Within Halfwords
DSHD  Doubleword Swap Halfwords Within Doublewords
DROTR Doubleword Rotate Right
DROTR32 Doubleword Rotate Right Plus 32 
DROTRV Doubleword Rotate Right Variable
ROTR Rotate Word Right
ROTRV Rotate Word Right Variable
MADD.fmt Floating Point Multiply Add (noop - soft float mandate)
MSUB fmt Floating Point Multiply Subtract (noop - soft float mandate)
NMADD fmt Floating Point Negative Multiply Add (noop - soft float mandate)
NMSUB fmt Floating Point Negative Multiply Subtract (noop - soft float mandate)
RECIP fmt Reciprocal Approximation (noop - soft float mandate)
RSQRT fmt Reciprocal Square Root Approximation (noop - soft float mandate)
```

Relevant issue from `kona` for `mips64r2` target support: https://github.com/op-rs/kona/issues/942

topIssues.title: Drippie dashboards and alerting
topIssues.author: pauldowman
topIssues.body: There's a [drippie dashboard](https://optimistic.grafana.net/d/fdph1c0hdlrlsd/drippie-mon?orgId=1&from=now-6h&to=now&timezone=browser&var-cluster=opfnd-prod-web-primary&var-namespace=airbyte) already but it needs to be configured. We will also need to add [alerting rules](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/k8s/tree/master/grafana-cloud/rules).

topIssues.title: Stage 1.4 shipping checklist
topIssues.author: pauldowman
topIssues.body:
Tracking some things that need to be done before shipping Asterisc:

- [x] Give Coinbase security the opportunity to audit
- [ ] Publish the audit results in https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/tree/develop/docs/security-reviews

topPRs.title: feat: add feature flagging functionality to SystemConfig
topPRs.author: smartcontracts
topPRs.body: Adds a function to the SystemConfig for feature flagging. Features are identified by 32 byte strings and can be toggled on or off by the ProxyAdmin or the owner of the ProxyAdmin. Note that this commit does not actually use any feature flags but demonstrates what a feature flag would look like by adding in the flag for the ETHLockbox feature.

topPRs.title: circleci, op-acceptance-tests: nightly ci sync tests with external networks
topPRs.author: nonsense

topPRs.title: feat(u16a): remove super root migration from portal
topPRs.author: smartcontracts
topPRs.body: Removes the super root migration logic from the OptimismPortal contract for u16a. Skips a number of tests/functions that used this logic previously. Logic will be reintroduced in a future release.

completedItems.title: op-node: fix comment for `l1.cache-size`
completedItems.body: The `defaultCacheSize` is `3/2` worth of sequencing window according to [here](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/aa4db40408094803cf9bc05277734572df46088a/op-node/node/node.go#L186).

completedItems.title: ci: Run the publish-cannon-prestates job on circleci boxes instead of latitude
completedItems.body:
Run the publish-cannon-prestates job on circleci boxes instead of latitude

It doesn't need lots of resources and we're seeing network flakiness so try uploading from a different network.

topContributors.summary: Wazabie: Focused on preparing for upgrades across multiple Sepolia testnets, opening three PRs (ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops#1182, #1181, #1180) to update Mode, Metal, and Zora from U13 to U16, while also modifying 31 files with 544 additions and 19 deletions. Their work primarily involved documentation, indicating a focus on preparatory and informational updates.

geoknee: Today, geoknee focused on documentation and other work, contributing to the `ethereum-optimism/design-docs` repository with an open PR (#333) to update the calculation for DB growth, and actively participated in code reviews, providing 12 reviews with 11 comments.

chuxinh: Focused on significant data analysis work, adding a new chain analysis output in ethereum-optimism/op-analytics via PR #1740, which involved a substantial change of over 44k lines. This contribution highlights a primary focus on expanding analytical capabilities.

nonsense: nonsense focused on significant code changes, modifying 62 files (+1183/-333 lines) across 12 commits, primarily contributing to other work, tests, and bug fixes, with a notable open PR in ethereum-optimism/optimism#17314. Their contributions primarily involved changes to tests and config files, and they provided 6 review comments.
